content:
I do not have personal experience, but here are some of the unique artifacts or pieces of history that visitors can see on display in gotland's museums:

1. the spillings hoard: this is one of the largest viking treasure hoards ever found in gotland, consisting of over 14,000 silver coins and other precious objects.

2. the visby cathedral: this is a medieval cathedral that was built in the 12th century and is still one of the most impressive buildings on the island. visitors can see its impressive architecture and learn about its history.

3. the gotland museum: this museum is dedicated to the history of the island and has a large collection of artifacts from various periods, including viking and medieval times. one of its most unique exhibits is the iron age bog bodies, which are well-preserved human remains that were discovered in a peat bog on the island.

4. the fornsalen museum: this museum is located in a former church and houses a collection of prehistoric artifacts, including stone age tools, bronze age jewelry, and viking-era weapons.

5. the lummelunda cave: this natural cave system is located on the island and is open to visitors. inside, visitors can see impressive rock formations and learn about the cave's history, including its use as a hideout for smugglers in the 18th and 19th centuries.
